messages.author: akalin
messages.text: unfortunately, deque::erase is O(n). Can you do something similar to RemovePendingWritesForStream where you keep track of *out_it and then delete everything after that? May want to copy that loop above and replace the conditional. I don't know if it's worth decomping out into a helper method.

messages.author: Ryan Hamilton
messages.text:

> RemovePendingWritesForStream where you keep track of *out_it and then delete
> everything after that? May want to copy that loop above and replace the
> conditional. I don't know if it's worth decomping out into a helper method.

Done.

messages.author: akalin
messages.text: Curious -- are we worried about re-entrancy here? If not, seems easier to use lower_bound to find the first stream > last_good_stream_id and start deleting from there

messages.author: akalin
messages.text: i don't know if it's worth having the same comment in both the .h and the .cc file. But I guess it's consistent.

messages.author: Ryan Hamilton
messages.text:
On 2013/04/17 21:14:20, akalin wrote:
> i don't know if it's worth having the same comment in both the .h and the .cc
> file. But I guess it's consistent.

Yeah, I was surprised to see them too, but decided to be consistent.  However, I've removed *all* these redundant comments.  Cool?
